ZoomInfo SalesOS Overview
edit

What is ZoomInfo SalesOS?

ZoomInfo SalesOS is the modern go-to-market platform for B2B companies. We have the biggest, most accurate, and most frequently refreshed database of insights, intelligence, and purchasing intent data about companies and contacts. We layer additional tools on top of that intelligence—such as conversation intelligence (Chorus), sales engagement (Engage), and data orchestration (RingLead)—to help you engage with prospects and customers. By integrating all of these tools with the other key systems you use, your go-to-market teams will be more prepared and well equipped to close more deals and hit their number.

Product Description

Find your next customer with ZoomInfo SalesOS, the biggest, most accurate, and most frequently refreshed database of contact and company insights, intelligence, and purchasing intent data, all in one, modern go-to-market platform.

How do you position yourself against your competitors?

Anyone can scrape data from the internet and claim to have the most contacts - but does it still matter if it isn’t actionable? No one invests as much time and effort into cleaning and validating data as ZoomInfo. Our data team alone, with over 300 human researchers, is larger than many of the businesses selling alternative solutions. Our dedication to your success goes beyond contact data, equipping your team with the information they need to be successful and the tools they need to take action on it. Building an alternative tech stack for your team is possible - but no one else can deliver the same quality in a ready-to-use package as ZoomInfo SalesOS.

Description

ZoomInfo (Nasdaq: ZI) is a global leader in go-to-market intelligence solutions.

Our platform empowers business-to-business sales, marketing, and recruiting professionals to hit their number by pairing best-in-class technology with unrivaled data coverage, accuracy, and depth of contacts. The company‚Äôs large and diversified customer base consists of over 20,000 customers from global enterprises, mid-market companies, and small businesses.

On June 4, 2020, ZoomInfo became a publicly traded company, listing on Nasdaq as one of the largest technology initial public offerings of the past decade.

ZoomInfo is headquartered in Vancouver, Washington and employs over 2,500 employees with offices across the U.S., Israel, UK and India.

ZoomInfo celebrated a banner year for company culture awards in 2021! In addition to the 15 Comparably Awards, ZoomInfo was named to Fortune‚Äôs list of the Best Workplaces for Millennials as well as several top workplace awards in Oregon/Southwest Washington, Michigan, and Washington. ZoomInfo was also honored by MassTLC for its Inclusivity Impact and by the Worksite Wellness Council of Massachusetts for its corporate health improvement and wellness program.

ZoomInfo has a hybrid work model with some employees fully remote, and others working remotely and coming into the office a few times a week.

To learn more about ZoomInfo visit www.zoominfo.com

To join our team of difference makers visit www.zoominfo.com/about/careers

"Okay Product but Terrible Customer Service"

What do you like best about ZoomInfo SalesOS?

The ability to pull contact information is the only reason why we use ZoomInfo. They are the leader in the NA market. Their available data is not perfect, but it's the best we've found. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

What do you dislike about ZoomInfo SalesOS?

Their customer service is absolutely terrible. They constantly reach out trying to up-sell, and then when we actually meet with them, they're not helpful. The real kicker for us is the auto-renewal without any notice. We were planning to non-renew because their Engage product is not as good as others, but the auto-renewed us (and renewed us for more licenses than we need) without talking to us and are not willing to work with us. If you want to be constantly, annoyingly, up-sold and locked into renewals you didn't ask for, ZoomInfo is the company for you. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

What problems is ZoomInfo SalesOS solving and how is that benefiting you?

We need to be able to find contact data for contacts at prospect companies for outbound outreach. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

"NOT A PRODUCT FOR SMB COMPANIES"

What do you like best about ZoomInfo SalesOS?

I would not recommend Zoominfo to small business sales teams, for a variety of reasons, but put shortly:

The investment is not worth it.

1. If you work with small business organizations, the zoominfo platform often will not be able to find your buyers - owners, etc. especially in the 1/2-$10/mil revenue space. It's great about finding large companies and corporations, but it's not suited for small business emails, phone numbers, and websites.

2. intent tool is useless. even though you can see searches going on, we've been unable to execute on that information and intel in a meaningful way to generate appointments. For larger organizations with big marketing teams and endless supllies of SDRs this tool is needed, but if you're a small sales team and each seller does a little of marketing and selling, the intent will not be helpful because it requires a lot of setup and infrastructure. we ran several intent tests and were never able to execute.

No notice of Contract Renewals - stuck with a super high prirce tag.

3. If you go with zoominfo, be extremely careful with how you set up your contract, and specifcally ask for NON-AUTO renewal. My contract autorenewed with 20% increase and i got one email at 60 days with a subject line: your subscribtion is set to autorenew automatically. No call with a rep, no date on when renewal is.

I tried to cancel my contract at 45 days, and my rep said, sorry. you're stuck. there's no way out. They will push you to "allocate" that spend to another product but will do nothing to help you reduce the spend.

Who would I recommend ZI to?

If you're a sales leader of a large organization with unlimited budget, zoominfo is a great tool.

Who I wouldn't?

If you're a smaller organization - I would highly suggest alternative tools. the flashy-iness of ZI does not merit the invoice, unfortunately, and you will not have support. Just a brand new kid out of college telling you sorry there's nothing we can do for you when you need help. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

What do you dislike about ZoomInfo SalesOS?

customer service

contract renewals unclear

not able to find the leads we need Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

What problems is ZoomInfo SalesOS solving and how is that benefiting you?

Zoominfo is creating a lot of problems for me, and not solving any. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

Apr 26, 2023(Original Jun 28, 2022)

"Must Have Tool for Prospecting"

What do you like best about ZoomInfo SalesOS?

The Scoops and Intent functions allow my team to spend our time on prospects already researching about software we provide. It's absurd how much of a difference maker this has been for our team and myself personally.

To compound on that point, the Direct phone number and contact accuracy filters really help me get to accurate prospects quicker without wasting time going through a phone tree or gatekeeper. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

What do you dislike about ZoomInfo SalesOS?

The only thing I dislike is the current bug of not being able to mass 'Complete' or skip contacts that are overdue. It makes me do it 25 contacts at a time... I went on vacation and had 700 overdue contacts so that took a few minutes to get straight....

Other than that, I wish there were the options to push someone into a Drip Salesflow automatically from a previous salesflow to keep trying for engagement. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

What problems is ZoomInfo SalesOS solving and how is that benefiting you?

ZI Engage is solving the problem of founding of who and how to contact people to drive revenue for my company. It's been a complete game changer and I'd never work without it again. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

"The info you need to reach your prospects!"

What do you like best about ZoomInfo SalesOS?

No solution on the market can get you the contact information or the intent data that ZoomInfo can. Using ZI, I can find out how to reach my prospects and target them with relevant messaging (very often geared towards known competitor pain points)! Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

What do you dislike about ZoomInfo SalesOS?

I find that very often, the organization maps and contact info is quite inaccurate. While ZoomInfo is a game changer, it cannot be used as a standalone intelligence tool and needs to be coupled with another solution, such as LISN. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

What problems is ZoomInfo SalesOS solving and how is that benefiting you?

Aside from the obvious use case around contact information that ZoomInfo provides, one of the most valuable tools within ZI is the intent data they can provide. We can measure intent on our website with our native tools but seeing that external or competitor intent data allows us to reach out at a time when the prospect is most interested! What do you like best about ZoomInfo SalesOS?

"Prospecting Made Easy"

What do you like best about ZoomInfo SalesOS?

I like that there are several filters for removing prospects and that it has become more tied into ZoomInfo Engage. The layout is pretty good and with the new updates, adding them to sales flows is now a breeze. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

What do you dislike about ZoomInfo SalesOS?

I wish we could drag and sort by columns. I know you can edit some out, but the layout can leave a lot to be desired in some cases. I also wish some company entries could be consolidated. For example, Gold Medal Industries and GMI in Ohio could be combined because it's the same company. It'd also be nice if a line on the main page showed if a company is a subsidiary of another company. For example, Quaker Oats is owned by PepsiCo or Bulk Apothecary is owned by Natural Essentials. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

What problems is ZoomInfo SalesOS solving and how is that benefiting you?

It helps me by having the information all in one section. When I was with another company, we had to find all that information ourselves and gatekeepers made it very hard. ZoomInfo SalesOS will (often) tell me their direct number, business email, what branch they're in, etc. This helps me prospect properly instead of wasting my time trying to skirt around a gatekeeper or trying to figure out a name to contact. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

"Best Sales Tool I've Used in 10 Years"

What do you like best about ZoomInfo SalesOS?

We've tried several tools on our sales team and ZoomInfo has been the best. The accurate information has helped us reach the right person in fewer attempts. The reports and insights help bring warm leads to us vs. having to go out and search for them. The time and productivity it has created is beneficial. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

What do you dislike about ZoomInfo SalesOS?

It can be overwhelming initially because of all it has to offer. The team at ZoomInfo was great about walking us through all the different features and provided several training courses. It gets easier the more you use it. I don't like that the admin must be a user. I would like it if the admin could have its own login view to facilitate for the team and use all of the user licenses for the sales reps. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

What problems is ZoomInfo SalesOS solving and how is that benefiting you?

The Salesforce integration saves us time for creating new customer profiles. Previously it was challenging to find the decision-maker within the first 3 attempts. Now we can get to them quickly to make decisions faster. Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
